meanings.definition: To surpass in charm or attractiveness.
meanings.sent1: The new puppy outcharms all the other pets in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Her smile always outcharms everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outcharms the grumpy old man with her cheerful laughter.
meanings.sent4: The colorful flowers outcharmed the plain green bushes in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The magical sunset outcharms any painting I have ever seen.

meanings.definition: To be more charming than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The talented singer outcharms all the other contestants in the competition.
meanings.sent2: His wit and humor always outcharms his friends in social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten outcharms the sleepy old cat with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outcharmed any material gift he could have received.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt apology outcharms any excuse he could come up with.
